November 30, 2018
Hello - I’m Jim Quercetti, a 14 year EMC veteran. Most folks know me as “Q”. I joined Pivotal in April this year and I’m excited to be a part of the new Pivotal Synergy Sales Team covering the South. My focus is working with the joint SAB teams driving digital transformation opportunities with focus on Pivotal Ready Architecture adoption for our customers.
1. VPay Win in Commercial: WIN FAST with PKS
Working with our friends at Dell EMC and VMware, we were able to secure a competitive win with an electronic payment solution customer:
- Dell EMC team uncovered a container opportunity. The competition had gotten there first.
- The account executive registered the opportunity on Pivotal Pulse <[[http://pivotal.io/pivotalpulse]]>.
- We jumped on a quick call to discuss the opportunity.
- We had only a few days to showcase the power of PKS to VPay. VMware’s PKS Team leaned in to help us as out since our technical folks were booked - they killed it.
- From our first call to verbal commitment from the CIO was just over (6) weeks. VMware was able to convert this into a Enterprise License Agreement (ELA) and add additional products.
Great SAB collaborative WIN that proves we can go down market and run fast to win! #BetterTogether
2. need to identify a Target Pivotal Customer? We built a Tool.
Clinton Reeves, one of our inside sales wizards, created a “propensity BI tool” to help all of us dial into our joint account targets quickly. The tool leverages data pools from from Discover.Org to help us score accounts, determine which ones have started down the digital transformation path and identify accounts which would benefit from joint sales discussions. Use the Opportunity Registration form <[[https://partners.pivotal.io/English/General_DT_Info.aspx#salesopportunityreg]]> to start the conversation with your Pivotal peer and leverage this tool to learn more about joint accounts with higher propensity for buying a Pivotal solution.
3. What's all the hubbub about Application Containers?
First, let's talk about explosive growth. The server virtualization market which we all fell in love with back in the early 2000’s is expected to grow at approximately USD 8 Billion by 2023, at 7% of CAGR <[[https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/reports/server-virtualization-market-3981]]> between 2017 and 2023 compared to the emerging Application Container market, which is expected to grow from USD 0.89 billion in 2017 to USD 4.42 billion by 2023, at a CAGR of 31.1% <[[https://www.marketresearchfuture.com/reports/application-container-market-6582]]> during the same forecasted period. Second, Containers are the fastest growing technology in the Data Center - Faster, lighter, adds to our virtualization story, enables hybrid cloud and it’s an infrastructure led sales play. Are you getting your fair share of the business? Start by asking a few simple questions:
- Are you using Kubernetes or Docker?
- Are you using multiple clouds? Which ones?
- Are developers asking for container/Kubernetes solution?
- Do you have COTS apps that are distributed as Docker Images?
- Are you familiar with the steps involved in building a K8s environment?
If you think you have a Pivotal Container Service opportunity register it here <[[https://partners.pivotal.io/English/General_DT_Info.aspx#salesopportunityreg]]> for Pivotal field support.

5. Pivotal Days : Enterprise Grade Kubernetes on VxRail
New offering! Pivotal is hosting a half day customer event consisting of presentations and a demo to learn more about building an enterprise ready Container Orchestration solution that will enable you to provide on-premise "Kubernetes as a Service" model with Pivotal Container Service (PKS) and Pivotal Ready Architecture (PRA built on VxRail) in a stable, scalable and secure way. Dates and locations include:
- Los Angeles <[[https://connect.pivotal.io/Pivotal-Days-Los-Angeles.html]]>, Dec 3 - Washington DC <[[https://connect.pivotal.io/Pivotal-Days-Washington-DC.html]]>, Dec 4 - Austin, TX <[[https://connect.pivotal.io/Pivotal-Days-Austin.html]]>, Dec 17
- Q
